definition[0]: to make yourself feel interested, brave etc
example[0]: I’m trying to work up enough courage to go to the dentist.
definition[1]: to make yourself hungry or thirsty, or make yourself sweat, especially by doing physical exercise
example[1]: You can work up a really big thirst playing tennis.
definition[2]: to make someone very angry, excited, or upset about something
example[2]: She had worked herself up into a state.
definition[3]: to develop and improve something such as a project or a piece of writing
example[4]: Jack took notes which he would work up into a report later.
